moves.1. e4: The normal opening move for a fairly aggressive player.  Usually results in a sharp, competitive beginning.
moves.1... c5 2. Nc3 b6: Not the usual line in the silican.
moves.3. Bc4: Developing pieces is the most important part in the opening.
moves.3... e6: ? Pretty useless.  If he wanted the f-bishop to develop, why not e5?
moves.4. Nf3 Bb7 5. d3: Extra protection for the e-pawn, so the c-knight can move better.  Also allows the black squared bishop to develop.
moves.5... d5 6. exd5 exd5 7. Qe2+: In hindsight, this wasn't the best move.
moves.7... Ne7 8. Bb3 d4: ? If you attack a piece, make sure it can't move anywhere that would hurt your position...
moves.12... Bb7: knight is trapped, but it doesn't matter.
